subject: Leadership
title: Strategic Positioning
description: A quick win: understand Strategic Positioning.

hook.text: IKEA sells furniture cheaper than anyone yet is wildly profitable. The secret isn't cheap materialsâ€”it's positioning.

buildup.text: Positioning is choosing where to play and how to win. It means deliberately making trade-offs competitors won't.

discovery.text: IKEA's position: flat-pack, self-serve, beautiful design at low cost. Every choice reinforces the others. It's a system.

twist.text: Good positioning is hard to copy because it's a set of interlocking choices. Copying one piece without the rest fails.

climax.text: Leaders define positioning by answering: who do we serve, what do we offer, and what do we deliberately not do?

punchline.text: Position isn't where you are. It's what you choose not to be.
